articles.title: Data Toolbox for Reproducible Research in Computational Ecology
articles.contents:
The objective of this five-day workshop, co-organized by the FRB-CESAB and the GdR EcoStat, is to train young researchers in reproducibility, software development and version management tools (e.g. R, git, Rmarkdown, tidyverse, docker), applied to biodiversity research.

Program
Day 1
       Icebreaker and introduction of the week        Open science and Reproducible research        Research compendium        Version control (git) and collaboration (GitHub)
Day 2
       Data handling (dplyr)        Data visualization (ggplot2)        Literate programming (rmarkdown)
Day 3
       Optimization and pipeline toolkit (targets)        Dealing with R package versions (renv)        Containerization (Docker)        Building R packages
Day 4
       Subgroups projects
Day 5
       Subgroups projects

Pré-requis
The following software must be installed before the workshop: R (latest version), RStudio et git. Follow this tutorial to install your working environment.
You also need to create an account (free) on GitHub.
Corrections
If you see mistakes or want to suggest changes, please Create an issue on the source repository.
